sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's Tuesday, the 12th of July. Good morning, Europe. A very warm welcome to the program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Let's bring you up to date with our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Seeing into the stars, NASA's James Webb Telescope captures the most detailed image of our sprawling universe to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Europe braces itself for a summer scorcher as temperatures rise across the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The EU's latest figures show signs of a downtrend in the Eurozone's economy, but no recession has been forecast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One little speck of the universe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At a White House event, the world got to see its first full-color picture from the new James Webb Space Telescope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden unveiled the photo showing our universe brimming with galaxies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The image is the farthest humanity has ever seen into space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The image is the farthest humanity has ever seen into space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In part of this shot is light from not too long after the Big Bang, which was 13.8 billion years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a new window into the history of our universe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And today we're going to get a glimpse of the first light to shine through that window.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Light from other worlds, orbiting stars far beyond our own.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's astounding to me when I read this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Rainforest to the edge of time itself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The 10 billion euro James Webb Space Telescope was launched in December last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It will make all sorts of observations of the sky, but it has two overarching goals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: One is to take pictures of the very first stars to shine in the universe more than 13 billion years ago. The other is to probe far-off planets to see if they might be habitable. The first photo will be followed by four more galactic beauty shots from outside our solar system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Europe's expanding heatwave has reached the Iberian Peninsula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Spain has already suffered one bout of extremely hot weather this season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Now most communities are on a high temperature alert again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Andalusia and Extremadura are two of the regions where the mercury is expected to reach the highest levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I don't know what time of the day to go out because it's so hot all the time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Between the 12th and 14th of July, the maximum temperature will exceed 35 degrees in almost all of Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In many cities, it will exceed 40 degrees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The purple colours here show where there is danger of wildfires breaking out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As you can see, much of Iberia is at high risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And in some areas the situation is already critical.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Forest fires in Portugal have left 29 people injured this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Forest fires in Portugal have left 29 people injured this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The country is in a state of contingency until midnight on Friday due to exceptionally high temperatures and a heightened risk of more blazes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: During the state of contingency, individuals can be prosecuted if they do not comply with restrictions such as a ban on fireworks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: prosecuted if they do not comply with restrictions such as a ban on fireworks. Meanwhile in Rome, authorities suspect that criminals are behind a series of fires over the past month. They have caused widespread damage, sending huge plumes of smoke over the city, raining ash down on its inhabitants. European Commission on Economic Growth Europeans can expect lower growth and higher inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The European Commission will again revise downwards its economic forecasts for this year and next due to the consequences of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The vice president of the European Commission has issued a warning from Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We see that economic growth is proving quite resilient this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Still, one can expect some downwards revision, and even more so for the next year, because there are many uncertainties and risks, and unfortunately inflation continues to surprise on the upside, so it's once again going to be revised upwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Despite this new blow to growth expectations after two bleak years due to the pandemic, Dombrovskis said that for the time being there are no signs of recession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Predicted GDP growth in May was 2.7% for the Eurozone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A month later, annual inflation reached a new record of 8.6%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A private funeral for Japan's slain former premier Shinzo Abe is being held today following

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Monday's Suya gathering, which is a traditional Japanese ceremony much like a wake in Western culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It typically takes place the day before a funeral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Invited guests and family gathered at a temple in Tokyo on Sunday to offer condolences to the bereaved and say prayers for the dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Japan is still reeling from Abe's assassination on Friday when he was gunned down by a 41-year-old man while campaigning for elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Political leaders were among those paying their respects on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The subsequent resounding victory by the Liberal Democratic Party and its sister coalition partner extended their majority in the upper house.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It gives the government the ability to change Japan's constitution and its pacifist stance, something Abe had campaigned for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The war in Ukraine is seeing some of its most intense fights,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: both in the Donbass, where the artilleries keep shelling, and in the southern area of Kherson, where the Ukrainian army is trying to launch a counteroffensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Most of the war is about the control of the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The deputy general of NATO, Mircea Seona, has told Euronews Romania the latest changes in the front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Probably the destination and the finality of the war will be decided on the battlefield.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The political conditions between the two sides are too far apart today for us to see political conditions for a diplomatic solution for the time being.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So more war, unfortunately, more destruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In a certain moment, we hope, that conditions will be met for a political solution to be identified. But the thing that they withdraw from the Serpent Island, is that a sign that it will eventually end?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We knew that they pay a lot of attention to the recapturing of the Serpent Island.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is also very important for the whole of the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's only 40 kilometers outside of the Port of Constanza and the mouth of the Danube. That's a strategic piece of property. And the fact that Russia was forced to abandon the island because of the massive vigorous attacks by Ukraine is a very good sign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Also, it's a tactical victory, also for the morale of the Ukrainians, that's a lot, and of course for the freedom of navigation in the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Serpent Island in the Black Sea has become a symbol of Ukrainian determination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It was seized by Russia on the first day of the Russian invasion and was recently recovered by Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Aida Santidalonso, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: recently recovered by Ukraine. Aida Santidalonso, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Gas has stopped flowing through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline, which connects Germany directly with Russia through the Baltic Sea. It's shut down for maintenance and a scheduled annual inspection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But politicians in Europe fear that Moscow could decide not to turn the gas back on in the increasingly standoff situation over the ukraine war euronews reporter kate brady from berlin has more there's a harsh reality setting in here in germany and that is that if indeed nordstream one is not switched back on again then germany simply will not be ready. The head of Germany's energy regulator has warned in recent weeks that Germany currently has only about two to three months worth of gas in storage. And there is now that real concern that Nord Stream 1 won't be turned back on again in what would be seen as a political move here in Berlin by Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So Germany at the moment is scrambling to find other energy sources, but really there's only mid to long term solutions or measures rather to ease the impact of a potential gas shortage on the table. So already we've seen plans passed for an expansion of onshore wind farms, coal fuelled electricity plants are being fired back up again. But none of that is going to really help overnight. So Robert Harbeck, the Energy, Economy and Climate Minister, did say on Monday that European solidarity will indeed be necessary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But ultimately, Germany is preparing for the worst case scenario right now. We could potentially see rationing in a worst case scenario in the coming weeks and months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the public, too, are also preparing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They're being encouraged by the government to reduce their energy consumption already in a bid to try and save the gas that Germany currently has.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So they are, too, preparing for the worst case scenario in what might be a very long, expensive and cold winter here in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kate Brady, Euronews, Berlin.
